metadata.titel_preek: Divine Love Meets the Strongest Animal

kernfrasen: engage Death on its own territory, mano a mano
destroy him who has the power of death
pay Death what is owing to it
take the place of the perpetrators
The wages of sin is death

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The law of the jungle. And right now we happen to be the strongest animal.

mapping_structuur.doel_element: World under the power of Sin

theologische_implicaties: Humanity without God reverts to a sub-human, predatory state

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher takes a conventional political quote and re-activates it as a theological diagnostic for the 'Power of Sin'.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher masterfully weaves the Military domain (Warfare) with the Juridical domain (Complicity/Substitution) by redefining the 'weapons' of the war as 'suffering' and 'submission'.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Paradox: Christ conquers the enemy by refusing to use the enemy's weapons, effectively 'winning' through 'losing'.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activates the personification of Sin and Death as active 'Powers' rather than abstract concepts.
sterktes.voorbeeld: Sin as a 'personal intelligence with an implacable purpose'.

risicos.beschrijving: The personification of Sin/Death as 'independent entities' might lead to a dualistic view where human responsibility is diminished.
risicos.voorbeeld: Sin and Death... external to and independent of the human being.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregants may feel like victims of Sin rather than agents of it.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The funeral of JFK (National mourning/Death's reality)

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; bridges abstract theology to urgent ethical reality.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Emphasis on Christ destroying the power of the Devil.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Critique of 'the strongest animal' rhetoric in American policy.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Perfectly aligned with the Good Friday 'Reproaches' and the stripping of the altar.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the 'Powers' (Sin, Death, Devil) as active, military antagonists. It successfully avoids the 'Economic' trap of simple debt-payment by framing the Cross as a tactical subversion of the 'machinery of Death'. The use of the 'Strongest Animal' provides a visceral, embodied counter-point to the 'Lamb' imagery implicit in the liturgy.

revitalisatie_suggesties.huidige_status: Risk of being 'Dead' or historically problematic (anti-semitic).
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Explicitly map the 'perpetrator' role to the modern hearer.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: We are the ones holding the spear in the Pentagon review tribunal.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The tension between Sin as an 'external Power' and 'our own treason'.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Use the 'Slavery' metaphor to bridge the two: we are captured by an external power but are complicit in our servitude.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Suggests Christ is merely a victim of history.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Re-emphasize the 'purposeful' nature of the descent into death to maintain the 'Victor' entailment.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To describe the 'machinery of death' as a structure that needs dismantling.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound example of using CMT to bridge cosmic theology with immediate political and personal ethics.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: Focuses on the cognitive mapping of 'Power' rather than just the beauty of the JFK funeral imagery.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Analyzes the conceptual structures of the 'Powers' rather than the learning styles of the listeners.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals how the preacher uses the 'Strongest Animal' metaphor to disrupt the 'God is on our side' schema.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the personification of abstract nouns (Sin, Death) to create a 'Text World' of cosmic conflict.
